page.title: 01THE HISTORY OF GARSTANG
page.content: The original Domesday Book refers to the town as Cherestanc,and it belonged to the Lancasters.In those days Garstang was the 2nd largest parish in Wyre.The abbots of Cockersands were in 1311 given permission to hold two airs a year and a weekly market.All of these are still a major feature of the town today.The two fairs take the form of a Children's Parade and an Agricultural Show.Around the Cross are the only original cobblestones.The cross was restored in 1897 for Queen Victoria's jubilee.In the 19th century preachers could be heard reading aloud from the steps.Stoops Hall built in 1882 was the head-quarters of the King's Own regiment.One of the oldest houses is the Arts Centre,which used to be a boy's grammar school. By Junior 4 G.C.P.School.
